content.description:
Start below the center of the X to the left of roof in a mellower overhanging section.  Go straight up with some slight meandering for gear placements between bolts.  You will go through a mellow roof near the top.  Anchor is on big grass ledge. 

  From this anchor you can rappel with a 70m climber's right to the grass gully uphill from where you started the route.  Otherwise, an 80m will probably get you down or double rope rappel. 

  There is potential to continue beyond the first pitch, which could allow for walkoff.
content.protection: A single rack of nuts and cams to 1.5" for protection between 9 button head bolts. 2 bolt rap anchor installed 9/2018
content.location: Pass the Guardian/Lost Wall and Aurora Slab gullies and drop down to the other side of a talus apron.

content.description: This route climbs a good section of rock through a bolt or two into some moderate gear protected climbing. It starts on some green colored rock and ends on the same anchor as flying monkey to the right.
content.protection: Gear, bolts and a two bolt rap anchor
content.location: This the leftmost two routes on the small buttress that sits between yellow brick road and the approach to Aurora Slab.

climbs.name: Flying Monkey
climbs.fa: Lang Van Dommelen, Chris Williams, Barbara Johnson 2019

content.description: This moderate route climbs some interesting features with gear and bolts. It will improve with traffic
content.protection: Trad rack and bolts. 2 bolt anchor at the top of the wall.
content.location: Right most climb at the yellow brick road area, it’s the first route from the right on a small sub-buttress that marks the way towards aurora slabialous

pathTokens: Archangel Valley Sport and Traditional Climbing

content.description: A nice big face with a giant X crack through it.  Lots of potential for development in this area.  The cracks on this face could make for more excellent routes with some TLC.  Sport and sprad options abound.
